question.body: What property of eye structures allows broad visual image to be compressed on the photoreceptors of the retina as a sharp image?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the process of the lens changing shape of lens to adjust for looking at near objects.
Correct. The bending of light as it passes from one medium to another allows the image to be compressed to the back retina of the eye.
Incorrect. This is the process involved when the iris reduces pupil size in response to bright light conditions or looking at near objects.
